about: Hi! I am Amar Shah. I am currently an intern at Zhendong Su's group at ETH ZÃ¼rich. I finished my undergrad this past fall at the University of California, Berkeley studying Math and Computer Science (with a minor in Logic), advised by Professor Sanjit A. Seshia.
research: I am interested in building safe and verifiable software. Specifically, I aim to develop better tools for formal verification, programming languages, and automated reasoning.
teaching: I also really enjoy teaching, at Berkeley I have been on course staff for Math 1A: Calculus, CS 70: Discrete Math and Probability Theory, CS 170: Efficient Algorithms and Intractable Problems, and C191: Quantum Information Science and Technology
